radiographic_examinations.findings: low lung volumes, with right basilar subsegmental atelectasis
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: unchanged as compared with a study 11 months earlier

radiographic_examinations.findings: sinus tachycardia at 119 beats per minute, ST-segment elevations up to 3 mm in leads V1, V2, and V3; Q waves present in leads V2 and V3
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: persistent ST-segment elevations during a subsequent episode; complete resolution of ST-segment changes and restoration of R waves in leads V1, V2, and V3 21 months after presentation

radiographic_examinations.findings: akinesis of the anterior wall, hypokinesis of the apical and distal inferior walls, compensatory hyperkinesis of the basal anterior and basal inferior walls; left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) calculated to be 45%
severe segmental left ventricular dysfunction involving the septum, anteroseptal territory, and apex; estimated LVEF was 48%
